result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Robert Buckett in court.   Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson did not appear.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buckett moves to withdraw as counsel for reasons stated on the record.  Court grants request.  Warrant remains outstanding.
Dated 03/05/17, from Atty Buckett, regarding Motion to withdraw.
Filed by Atty Buckett.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Br. 4 ONLY

EXT=CODE 2

Case called at 9:40 a.m.  Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court.   Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buckett does not know why Defendant does not appear today and states that he has not had any recent contact with Defendant.  State requests a warrant and that bail be revoked and forfeited.  Court issues a capias- Br. 4 only.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.  Court cancels 12/11/15 court dates.  NOTE:  Attorney Buckett will not be available week of 11/23/15 if Defendant would call for an appearance.
(Fax) Dated 10/29/15, from Agent Kaczik to Judge Carter, notifying the Court of lack of cooperation for the Defendant to complete the PSI.
Sentencing hearing at 12-11-2015 02:00 pm
filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilyy plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Buckett requests a presentence investigation be ordered.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buckett requests an adjournment due to this new case and would like this to be resolved with Defendant's other case.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Buckett could not appear today, due to conflict.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing to schedule preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court finds the defendant is eligible for a court appointed attorney and appoints attorney Robert Buckett.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses/business or the businesses employees listed in the Criminal Complaint or the victims residence.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Melissa A Miletti Thompson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
